children.html: "Be you" is an ubiquitous slogan in self-help discourses. It is a call to be a heroic version of you, self-expressive, "living out loud", "breaking the mold", etc ... "Be you" is often used by commercial brands and businesses, in so called "cause marketing campaigns". It is often mistakenly presented as a cure-all, individualized solution against systemic problems of discriminations and oppression.

BeYou is a national cause marketing campaign created to increase self-esteem and empower females 
        aged 9 to 16 years across Canada. Developed by Morguard and presented in its portfolio of 21 shopping centres, 
        BeYou will give young girls access to personal and professional development tools, while celebrating their growth, 
        diversity and self-worth.

Don't dim your light

Don't hide your heart

Go show the world just exactly who you are

Stand tall,

Live out loud

Cause you're the only one you need to figure out

All you gotta do is be You

Be you you you you you

Yeah yeah

Mmm hmm

All you gotta do is be You

Be you you you you you

Yeah yeah

Only You

All you gotta do is be You

So go break the mold

'Cause no one else can be your shade of beautiful

You can paint the sky

Like fireworks

Go rain your colours down and shake the earth

...

title: Be you you you you you
